TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit FindFolderType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to find folders in a mailbox.

remarks.para: The FindFolder operation finds subfolders of an identified folder. The FindFolder operation returns only the first 512 bytes of any streamable property. For Unicode, the FindFolder operation returns the first 255 characters by using a null-terminated Unicode string. Use the GetFolder operation to get additional folder properties.
Restrictions on folder properties, but not item properties, are permitted. Sorting functionality is not available for FindFolder responses. Grouped queries are not available for FindFolder queries.

example.para: The following example shows a FindFolder query that returns the following results:

item.description: A deep traversal search of the Inbox.
All the properties that are defined for the Default FolderShape in a FindFolder operation.
All folders that have a display name of SentOnlyToMe. The case does not have to match.
A fractional paging scheme that returns at most a single folder that starts after the first folder.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::FolderResponseShapeType ^ FolderShape { ExchangeWebServices::FolderResponseShapeType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::FolderResponseShapeType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the shape of the query set. This property is required. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a object that contains the description of the properties that are requested to be returned in the result set.

remarks.para: The property describes which properties are returned by the FindFolder response.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::BasePagingType ^ Item { ExchangeWebServices::BasePagingType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::BasePagingType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the paging type that describes how the query result set is paged in the response. This property gets or sets either an or object. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a object that represents the type of paging to be performed for the query set.

remarks.para: The property can be set with either the or objects. All these types extend , which is an abstract class. This property is optional. If this property is not set, the default behavior is to return a view that includes all the folders in the result set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ ParentFolderIds { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::BaseFolderIdType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the folders that the FindFolder operation searches. This property is required. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns an array of objects that contains the identifiers of all the folders for the FindFolder operation to search.

remarks.para: The property can be set with arrays of either or objects. Both of these types extend , which is an abstract class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::RestrictionType ^ Restriction { ExchangeWebServices::RestrictionType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::RestrictionType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the search parameters that define a folder query. This property is optional. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a object that contains the search parameters that define the query.

remarks.para: The property, if it is used, should only use the folder properties. The property can contain the following search expressions:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::FolderQueryTraversalType Traversal { ExchangeWebServices::FolderQueryTraversalType get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::FolderQueryTraversalType value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the traversal scheme that is used to search for folders. This property is required. This is a read/write property.
Docs.value: The property returns a enumeration that defines the type of traversal that is performed for the search.

remarks.para: The FindFolder operation supports shallow and deep traversal folder searches.
